news_header: A Russian 'shadow fleet' is moving from Norway to Poland, raising concerns about cable disruptions in the Baltic Sea.
news_text: Polish authorities are monitoring the movements of a Russian 'shadow fleet' traveling from Norway to Poland, linked to a natural gas pipeline. Reports indicate that these vessels have been involved in cutting telecommunications and electricity cables in the Baltic Sea over the past year. NATO is initiating a special operation to safeguard these cables and oversee the activities of Russian-affiliated vessels. The 'shadow fleet' consists of third-country ships transporting goods or oil under Russian sanctions. Additionally, Finland has detained a tanker named Eagle S, suspected of cable interference.
